intro: Iranecio cariensis, commonly known as the Mexican firethorn, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Solanaceae, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its spiny stems and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant produces small, red berries that are edible when ripe but contain toxic compounds. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils and along coastal areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and natural reserves.
